source.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from
source.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: They get their money from various sources.
Beans are a very good source of protein.
For me, music is a great source of enjoyment.
Is your pension taxed at source  (=before it is paid to you)?
source.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the cause of something, especially a problem, or the place where it starts
source.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: We’ve found the source of the trouble.
The recent name change has been the source of some confusion.
source.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a person, book, or document that supplies you with information
source.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: List all your sources at the end of your essay.
I’ve heard from reliable sources that the company is in trouble.
source.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the place where a stream or river starts
source.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: Milk is a good source of calcium.
People said television was their most useful source of local information.
The lead mines were once a major source of employment for the islanders.
In times of stress, food can be a great source of comfort.
It started as a hobby, but now it is his main source of income.
The university is exploring alternative funding sources.
We hope to see increased usage of renewable energy sources.
Slugs attack potatoes in late summer, when other food sources are disappearing.
First, you need to turn off the power source.
The statue is illuminated by a hidden light source.
source.translation[1].definitions[0].def: if goods are sourced from a particular place, they are obtained from that place
source.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Fish for the restaurant is sourced daily from British ports.
source.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to find out where something can be obtained
source.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: We might be able to source the parts.
source.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from
source.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: They get their money from various sources.
Tourism in the area is a slowly-growing source of revenue, helped by the development of air transport networks.
source.translation[2].definitions[1].def: the cause of something, especially a problem, or the place where it starts
source.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The cuts are a source of concern to all of us.
The source of the problem is the inferior quality of our labour supply.
source.translation[2].definitions[2].def: a person, book, document etc that supplies you with information
source.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: Industry sources say that Chrysler is planning to increase production.
At the end of your dissertation, please list your sources, including websites.
source.translation[2].definitions[3].def: if tax is taken off your income at source, it is taken before you get any income
source.translation[2].definitions[3].exa: Tax deducted at source from certain investment income is reclaimable by non-taxpayers.
source.translation[3].definitions[0].def: if a company sources materials, parts etc from a particular place, it obtains them from there
source.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Components will be sourced from Polish producers.
